get.summary: Lists all API clients belonging to the caller.

post.summary: Creates an API client for the caller.

delete.summary: Deletes an API client belonging to the caller.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The client id to delete.

get.summary: Lists all IP filters. At the moment, this API is only available for root users.

post.summary:
Creates an IP filter item for IP blacklisting or whitelisting. At the moment,
this API is only available for root users.

delete.summary: Deletes an IP filter item. At the moment, this API is only available for root users.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The IP filter id to delete.

get.summary:
Gets subuser information. This call includes all of the subuser metadata. See
[https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/] for the list of supported attributes.
If the `{name}` parameter is `me` or `-`, returns the caller information, which
is equivalent to `WhoAmI()` or `GET:/iam/v*/whoami`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The subuser name to delete.

get.summary:
Gets user information about the caller. This call includes all of the user metadata.
See [https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/] for the list of supported attributes.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: Optional. The name of the operation's parent resource. Not used at the moment.

get.summary:
Gets the latest state of a long-running operation. You can use this method to
poll the operation result at intervals.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the operation resource.

delete.summary:
Deletes a long-running operation. This method indicates that the client is no
longer interested in the operation result. It does not cancel the operation.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the operation resource to be deleted.

post.summary:
Starts asynchronous cancellation on a long-running operation. The server makes
a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed. On successful
cancellation, the operation is not deleted; instead, it becomes an operation with
a value of [google.rpc.Status.code][google.rpc.Status.code] 1, corresponding
to `Code.CANCELLED`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the operation resource to be cancelled.

schema.description: Request message for the Operations.CancelOperation rpc.

get.summary: Gets information about the caller's organization.

put.summary:
Updates organization metadata. See [https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/]
for the list of supported attributes.

post.summary:
Sends (or resends) the verification email. Only valid for unverified
organizations. The verification key will be valid for a day.

Verifies an organization using the key received from the verification email.
The verification key is only valid for a day.

get.summary:
Gets an AWS management account. This call includes all of the account's metadata.
See https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/ for the list of supported attributes.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The id of the account to get.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The id of the management account.

get.summary:
Gets an AWS management account's update history, which is a list of timestamps our system tracks when the account's CUR files are
exported to your S3 by AWS, which in turn, triggers the import from your S3 to our system for processing.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The management account id to query.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description:
Optional. The month to query. If empty, defaults to current month.
Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

post.summary: Initiates an ondemand import of all registered CUR files.

Reads the usage-based tag costs of an AWS account. At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 
'aws'. If datetime range parameters are not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The AWS account id to stream.

post.summary:
Reads the non-usage-based details of an organization (Ripple) or billing group (Wave).
This API covers non-usage-based adjustments, such as Fees, Credits, Discounts, Tax,
Upfront Fees, etc. At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 'aws'. If datetime
range parameters are not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

companyId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the non-usage-based adjustment details of this billing group.
Valid only if `accountId` is not set. If both `companyId` and `accountId` are not
set, reads the adjustment details of the whole organization.
Only valid for Ripple users. Implied (or discarded) for Wave(Pro) users.

accountId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the non-usaged-based adjustment details of this account. Also
invalidates the `billingGroupId` value even if set. If both `billingGroupId` and
`accountId` are not set, reads the adjustment details of the whole organization.

startTime.description:
Optional. Timestamp to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the
current month will be used. Format: `yyyymmdd`.

endTime.description:
Optional. Timestamp to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be used.
Format: `yyyymmdd`.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadAdjustments rpc.

post.summary:
Reads the usage-based tag costs of a billing group. At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 
'aws'. If datetime range parameters are not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. The billing group id to stream.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required. Budget configuration to save.

get.summary:
Fetches budget configurations for all accounts under the specified billing group.
Set accountId to fetch budget configuration for specific account only.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

parameters.name: billingGroupId
parameters.description: Required. Billing group id to retrieve.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Optional. If set, only budget configuration for the specified account is returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

parameters.name: budgetConfigId
parameters.description: Required. Budget configuration id to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required. Budget configuration with update information.

post.summary:
Reads the usage-based cost details of an organization (Ripple) or billing group (Wave).
At the moment, the supported {vendor} is 'aws'. If datetime range parameters are
not set, month-to-date (current month) will be returned.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

companyId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the usage-based cost details of this billing group. Valid
only if `accountId` is not set. If both `companyId` and `accountId` are not set,
reads the usage-based cost details of the whole organization.
Only valid for Ripple users. Implied (or discarded) for Wave(Pro) users.

accountId.description:
Optional. If set, reads the usage-based cost details of this account. Also invalidates
the `billingGroupId` value even if set. If both `billingGroupId` and `accountId` are
not set, reads the usage-based cost details of the whole organization.

startTime.description:
Optional. Timestamp to start streaming data from. If not set, the first day of the
current month will be used. Format: yyyymmdd.

endTime.description:
Optional. Timestamp to end the streaming data. If not set, current date will be used.
Format: `yyyymmd`.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.ReadCosts rpc.

get.summary: Fetches month-to-date accumulated costs vs forecasted cost vs budget for the specified billing group.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

parameters.name: billingGroupId
parameters.description: Required. Billing group id to retrieve.

get.summary:
Fetches cost forecasts for the specified billing group.
Includes historical cost (up to previous month) and forecasted cost (up to three months for now).

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

parameters.name: billingGroupId
parameters.description: Required. Billing group id to retrieve.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description:
Optional. Forecast frequency. Valid values are `daily` and `monthly`. 
Default value is `daily`.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description:
Optional. Forecast granularity. Valid values are `account`, `category` and `product`.
Default value is `account`.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description:
Optional. Starting date to get data.
If from_date is less than current date, historical costs are included.
If from_date is greater than current date, only forecasted costs are returned.
Format: `yyyy-mm-dd`.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description:
Optional. Last date to get forecast cost. 
Currently, we only support 90 days forecasting from the first day of current month.
Format: `yyyy-mm-dd`.

post.summary: Triggers monthly calculations for costs and invoices at either organization or billing group level.

parameters.name: vendor
parameters.description: Required. Valid values are `aws`, `azure`, and `gcp`.

billingGroupId.description:
Optional. If set to a particular billing group, calculate for that billing group.
If empty, calculate for all billing groups.

At the moment, for AWS, this is only valid for account type billing groups, not
tag billing groups. If a tag billing group is provided, it is discarded and the
calculation is done for the whole organization.

month.description:
Optional. The month to calculate. If empty, it defaults to the previous month.
Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

schema.description: Request message for the Cost.CalculateCosts rpc.

clientSecret.description: API client secret. Only available during creation; otherwise, redacted.

parent.description:
The user's parent. If empty or non-existent, it means this user is a root user;
otherwise, it's a subuser.

metadata.description:
The attributes (key/value pair) of the user. If hierarchy is supported, it will be
separated by '/', such as 'key/subkey=value'. See https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/
for the list of supported attributes.

The attributes (key/value pair) of the account. If hierarchy is supported, it will be
separated by '/', such as 'metakey/subkey=value'. Supported attributes include 'createTime'.
If the account is a master (or payer) account, additional attributes include 'bucketName',
'lastModified' (last timestamp AWS updated CUR), 'prefix', 'reportName', 'roleArn', and
'lastImported' (last timestamp CUR is imported to Alphaus).

name.description:
The server-assigned name, which is only unique within the same service that
originally returns it. If you use the default HTTP mapping, the
`name` should be a resource name ending with `operations/{unique_id}`.

metadata.description:
Service-specific metadata associated with the operation.  It typically
contains progress information and common metadata such as create time.
Some services might not provide such metadata.  Any method that returns a
long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

done.description:
If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress.
If `true`, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is
available.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

response.description:
The normal response of the operation in case of success.  If the original
method returns no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is
`google.protobuf.Empty`.  If the original method is standard
`Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the resource.  For other
methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where `Xxx`
is the original method name.  For example, if the original method name
is `TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is
`TakeSnapshotResponse`.

blueapiapiOperation.description:
This resource represents a long-running operation that is the result of a
network API call.

typeUrl.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

name.description: The unique name (or id) of the organization.

email.description: The registered email of the organization.

metadata.description:
The metadata (key/value pair) of the organization. If hierarchy is supported, it will be
separated by '/', such as 'metakey/subkey=value'. See https://alphauslabs.github.io/blueapi/
for the list of supported attributes.

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

v1AdjustmentItem.description: Response message wrapper for cloud cost adjustments.

includeTags.description:
Optional. If set to true, stream will include resource tags. Note that this could
potentially increase the data size if you have lots of tag information.

includeCostCategories.description:
Optional. If set to true, stream will include resource cost category information.
Note that this could potentially increase the data size if you have lots of cost
category information.

companyId.description: The billing group's internal company id.

v1CostItem.description: Response message wrapper for cloud costs.

name.description: Required. The descriptive name of the API client to create.

v1CreateApiClientRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateApiClient rpc.

value.description:
Required. The IP input to filter, either blacklist or whitelist. Should be in
CIDR format (i.e. 1.2.3.4/32).

type.description: Optional. Can be `whitelist` or `blacklist`. Defaults to `blacklist` if empty.

rootUser.description:
Optional. If valid rootUser and subUser is empty, filter is for this rootuser.
If both rootUser and subUser inputs are empty, filter is at global scope.

subUser.description:
Optional. If valid subuser, filter is for this subuser; rootUser value is discarded.
If both rootUser and subUser inputs are empty, filter is at global scope.

v1CreateIpFilterRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateIpFilter rpc.

id.description: Required. The id of the management account.

name.description:
Optional. The name, or description of the management account.
This is set to `id` when not specified.

roleArn.description: Required. Role ARN for Alphaus to assume for access.

v1CreateManagementAccountRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.CreateManagementAccount rpc.

v1CreateOrgRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.CreateOrg rpc.

v1CreateOrgResponse.description: Response message for the Organization.CreateOrg rpc.

name.description:
Required. Min: 4, max: 18, allowed characters: letters, numbers, `_` (underscore),
`.` (period) and `-` (hyphen) characters.

email.description: Optional. Email address of the subuser.

nickName.description: Optional. Nickname or description. It is set to 'name' if empty.

v1CreateUserRequest.description: Request message for the Iam.CreateUser rpc.

v1GetBudgetConfigResponse.description:
Response message for GetBudgetConfig.
If accountId is specified in the request, only one budget configuration is returned.

v1GetForecastsResponse.description: Response message for GetForecasts per billing group.

id.description: The management account id being queried.

timestamps.description: The list of timestamps the account was updated and imported.

v1GetManagementAccountUpdateHistoryRespo.description: Response message for the Cost.GetManagementAccountUpdateHistory rpc.

v1GetMonthToDateForecastResponse.description: Response message for GetMonthToDateForecast per billing group.

month.description:
Optional. The month to import. If empty, it defaults to the current month.
Format is `yyyymm`. For example, June 2021 will be `202106`.

filter.description:
Optional. A comma-separated list of management accounts to import. If empty,
all CURs associated with all your management accounts will be imported.

v1ImportCurFilesRequest.description: Request message for the Cost.ImportCurFiles rpc.

id.description:
IP filter item id. Note that this name is transcient and is not fixed. However,
you can use any of its permutations to endpoints that accept it, such as
the `DELETE:/iam/v?/ipfilters/{id}` endpoint, without issues.

target.description:
The target of the filter. If global scope, this is usually empty.
Rootuser name for rootuser scope, and subuser name for subuser scope.
For subuser targets, format is `rootuser/subuser`.

type.description: The type of IP filter. It could be `whitelist` or `blacklist`.

value.description: The IP filter value. Should be in CIDR format.

v1UpdateMetadataRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.UpdateMetadata rpc.

v1UpdatePasswordRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.UpdatePassword rpc.

v1VerifyOrgRequest.description: Request message for the Organization.VerifyOrg rpc.
